meanings.definition: A protein found in egg whites that binds with biotin and prevents its absorption.
meanings.sent1: The conalbumin in egg whites can stop biotin from being absorbed.
meanings.sent2: I added conalbumin to my omelette for extra protein.
meanings.sent3: Why did the biotin refuse to enter the body? Because the conalbumin blocked its way!
meanings.sent4: The conalbumin acted like a gatekeeper, denying entry to the biotin.
meanings.sent5: Imagine conalbumin as a shield, protecting biotin from harm.
